info.description: Payment Order Application (POA) is a Temenos Payments Application that helps bank manage their Payment Orders before they are being sent for payment execution by the bank's payment system. It provides Order Management functionality for Payers to initiate, view and manage their orders from an online channel offered by payer's bank or authorized third party. This page lists the APIs offered by Temenos Payment Order Application to perform Order Management for Payers.
info.title: Payment Orders

get.summary: Retrieve a list of Payment Orders
get.description: Retrieve a list of authorised Payment Orders based on a specific criteria

parameters.name: paymentOrderId
parameters.description: The unique reference number of payment

parameters.name: currentState
parameters.description: Contains the current state of the transaction

parameters.name: paymentStatus
parameters.description: Describes the current status of the payment order in the payment system

parameters.name: paymentOrderProductId
parameters.description: Indicates the payment order product for which payment is initiated

parameters.name: debitAccountId
parameters.description: Indicates the debit account number of the payment or transaction.

parameters.name: orderingCustomerId
parameters.description: Indicates the customer id for the ordering customer

parameters.name: uniqueTransactionReference
parameters.description: Unique transaction reference details

parameters.name: executionDate
parameters.description: Date on which the transaction or payment gets processed, i.e. the processing date of the transaction.

parameters.name: bulkReference
parameters.description: Contains bulk master reference for the payment.

parameters.name: paymentSource
parameters.description: Indicates the source from where the payment is originated

parameters.name: page_size
parameters.description: The total number of records per page

parameters.name: page_start
parameters.description: The record from which the response should be displayed

parameters.name: page_token
parameters.description: Unique id expected to get as part of response from Transact on every enquiry request.

parameters.name: credentials
parameters.description: Username and password to authenticate the API against core-banking.

parameters.name: companyId
parameters.description: Identifier of the lead company of the underlying Entity/Company/Branch for the respective contract for customer data protection purposes. Example US0010001.

parameters.name: deviceId
parameters.description: Identifies the device type

parameters.name: userRole
parameters.description: User who initiated the transaction

parameters.name: disablePagination
parameters.description: Indicates the pagination header attributes availability. If set to 'true', it fetches all the data

post.description: Create a new Payment Order.  This API can be called in validate or commit mode. Former validates and responds back with status (and errors if any). Latter validates and commits if there are no validation errors.  While creating Instant Payment Orders, set teh value of Local Instrument Code to INST.

parameters.name: payload
parameters.description: body Payload

parameters.name: validate_only
parameters.description: The identifier to indicate if it is set to only validate or not.

parameters.description: Username and password to authenticate the API against core-banking.

parameters.description: Identifier of the lead company of the underlying Entity/Company/Branch for the respective contract for customer data protection purposes. Example US0010001.

parameters.name: deviceId
parameters.description: Identifies the device type

parameters.name: userRole
parameters.description: User who initiated the transaction

get.summary: Retrieve the payments eligible for recall
get.description: Retrieve completed payments that are eligible for recall

parameters.name: orderingCustomerId
parameters.description: Indicates the customer id for the ordering customer

parameters.name: paymentOrderId
parameters.description: The unique reference number of payment

parameters.name: paymentOrderProductId
parameters.description: Indicates the payment order product for which payment is initiated

parameters.name: startDate
parameters.description: Contains the date on which the transaction or payment gets initiated.

parameters.name: endDate
parameters.description: Indicates the date till which the transaction history requested. If 20120101 is the start date and 20120201 is the end date, all transactions that are booked between January 1 to February 1 2012 are returned

parameters.name: page_size
parameters.description: The total number of records per page

parameters.name: page_start
parameters.description: The record from which the response should be displayed

parameters.name: page_token
parameters.description: Unique id expected to get as part of response from Transact on every enquiry request.

code.description: The code related to override message.

responseCode.description: The user input to accept/reject the override.

narratives.description: The additional text printed on descriptive statements in addition to the standard narrative and/or reference

narrative.description: The additional text printed on descriptive statements in addition to the standard narrative and/or reference

additionalInformations.description: Additional Information provided to add context

additionalInformation.description: Additional Information provided to add context

remittanceInformations.description: Indicates the remittance information that is supplied to enable the matching/reconciliation of an entry with the items that the payment is intended to settle, such as commercial invoices in an accounts' receivable system, in an unstructured form.

remittanceInformation.description: Indicates the remittance information that is supplied to enable the matching/reconciliation of an entry with the items that the payment is intended to settle, such as commercial invoices in an accounts' receivable system, in an unstructured form.

beneficiaryAddresses.description: The address of the Beneficiary if the customer number of the Beneficiary is not known

beneficiaryAddress.description: The address of the Beneficiary if the customer number of the Beneficiary is not known

signatories.description: Indicates the authorised signatories for the payments. More applicable in case of corporate payments where multiple signatories are required to sign a payment instruction

signatory.description: The authorised signatories for the payments can be specified here. More applicable in case of corporate payments where multiple signatories are required to sign a payment instruction

invoiceReferences.description: It provides the reference of the invoice

invoiceReference.description: It provides the reference of the invoice

charges.description: Defines the charges collected for a transaction

chargeType.description: Indicates the charge types which are applicable for the transaction. Example: CORRBKCHG

chargeName.description: The description of the charge to be taken for payment

chargeCurrency.description: Indicates the currency code of the charge account from where the fee is deducted

chargeAmount.description: Retrieves the Charge Amount after redeem

chargeAccountCurrencyAmount.description: Holds the charge to be applied for the corresponding charge type for the order in the currency of the charge account

overrides.description: The override message is captured  that was generated at the time of commitment of the transaction to the database.

override.description: The override message is captured  that was generated at the time of commitment of the transaction to the database.

reasons.description: Contains the reason for the creation of the Mandate

reason.description: Contains the reason for the creation of the Mandate

accountWithInstitutionAddresses.description: Contains the additional address lines of the account with institution.

accountWithInstitutionAddress.description: Contains the additional address lines of the account with institution.

contextNames.description: Field name returned by the payment engine (TPH) for information or further processing.

contextName.description: Field name returned by the payment engine (TPH) for information or further processing.

contextValues.description: Field value returned by the payment engine (TPH) for information or further processing.

contextValue.description: Field value returned by the payment engine (TPH) for information or further processing.

messageType.description: Defines the type of swift messages that are sent or received for a transaction

incomingMessageType.description: Indicates the supported message type to be received from the clearing house or the direct participant.

paymentOrderProductId.description: Indicates the payment order product for which payment is initiated

debitAccountId.description: Indicates the debit account number of the payment or transaction.

debitAccountIBAN.description: International Bank Account Number (IBAN) of the debtor account, required only for International transfers/payments outside the Bank. For example: GB98 MIDL07009312345678, FR7630006000011234567890189

debitCurrency.description: Currency of the debit account. For example: USD, EUR etc.

debitValueDate.description: Date on which the amount will be debited for settlement

creditAccountId.description: Credit account identifier of the payment or transaction

creditAccountIBAN.description: Indicates the IBAN of the credit account

orderingCustomerId.description: Indicates the customer id for the ordering customer

orderingCustomerName.description: Indicates the name of Ordering Customer

executionDate.description: Date on which the transaction or payment gets processed, i.e. the processing date of the transaction.

treasuryRate.description: The Treasury rate for the conversion between payment currency and the ordering currency

forexSpread.description: The spread that is applied to the published internal exchange rates to derive the final exchange rate or the customer rate for the transaction for currency conversion between ordering currency and payment currency

orderingPaymentFxCustomerRate.description: The customer rate for the conversion between payment currency and ordering currency

orderingPortfolio.description: Indicates the portfolio id for the debit side if the account belongs to a specific portfolio

creditPortfolio.description: Indicates the portfolio id for the credit side if the account belongs to a specific portfolio

orderingReference.description: The reference related to the ordering details

chargeBearer.description: Bearer of the charges of the order. For example: BEN(All transaction charges are to be borne by the beneficiary customer.), OUR(All transaction charges are to be borne by the ordering customer.), SHA(Transaction charges on the Sender's side are to be borne by the ordering customer, transaction charges on the Receiver's side are to be borne by the beneficiary customer.)

beneficiaryId.description: Indicates the reference of the financial institution that allows access to the beneficiary information

beneficiaryAccountId.description: Unique account identifier of the beneficiary account number.

beneficiaryBIC.description: BIC (Bank Identifier Code) of the beneficiary customer

beneficiaryName.description: Short title or short name of the beneficiary

accountWithBankBIC.description: This is the BIC code of the institution where beneficiary holds an account

beneficiaryBankClearingCode.description: Clearing code or sort code of the beneficiary bank

accountWithBankClearingCode.description: This is the national clearing code or sort code of the institution where beneficiary holds an account

clearingChannel.description: Indicates the clearing channel for the payment in the ISO format of the Clearing System Identifiers

structuredCreditorReference.description: Contains description of the credit account reference

beneficiaryIBAN.description: International Bank Account Number (IBAN) of the beneficiary account, required only for International transfers/payments outside the Bank. For example: GB98 MIDL07009312345678, FR7630006000011234567890189

accountWithBankIBAN.description: This is the IBAN of the institution where beneficiary holds an account

requiredCreditValueDate.description: The credit value date i.e. tentative date on which the payment system will process the payment

purpose.description: Purpose identifier of the payment or transaction, for SEPA payments in general.

structuredCommunicationCode.description: Creditor reference in a coded form i.e - RADM (RemittanceAdviceMessage) - RPIN (RelatedPaymentInstruction) - FXDR (ForeignExchangeDealReference) - DISP (DispatchAdvice) - PUOR (PurchaseOrder) - SCOR (StructuredCommunicationReference)

endToEndReference.description: Indicates the end to end reference for the payment. This field can be provided by the person who instructs the payment and this flows through the lifecycle of the payment.

instructionIdReference.description: Indicates the SEPA purpose of the SEPA Payment

termsAndConditions.description: Specifies the terms and conditions in the text format for the payment instruction, if any.

indicativeRate.description: The indicative rate at the time of submitting a payment initiation request. Actual rate with which the payment will be processed will be calculated/ fetched during payment processing.

chargeAccountId.description: Indicates the account to which the charges has to be levied. Used when charges are to be taken from a separate account

chargeAccountCurrencyId.description: When a charge account is specified, this field indicates the currency of the charge account

creditValueDate.description: Reference quoted by the credit account for a payment

PSDCompliant.description: Defines whether the transaction is PSD (Payment Services Directive) compliant or not.

totalDebitAmount.description: The total debit amount including the charges associated for the payment

localInstrumentCode.description: List of transfer type has been mentioned locally in a record

recordStatus.description: General status of the record. Possible values: - null - authorised - IHLD - input, on hold - INAU - input, not authorised - INA2 - input, authorised, pending second authorisation - INAO - input, not authorised with blocking overrides - RNAU - reversed, not authorised - RNAO - reversed, not authorised with blocking overrides

bulkReference.description: Contains bulk master reference for the payment.

bulkTypeId.description: Identifier of the bulk update type record that holds default conditions required for Bulk Master creation. SINGLE and MULTI are two record references used by payment order application for processing payments induced through Bulk Master.

action.description: Refers to view or cancel options.

cancelReason.description: Contains the reason for which the payment is cancelled.

cancelRemark.description: Contains the remarks given for cancellation.

initiationTime.description: Initiation of the payment time details

orderInitiationType.description: It indicates whether the payment was initiated by bank user, corporate or private client

beneficiaryPhoneNumber.description: Contains phone number of the beneficiary.

beneficiaryEmailId.description: Contains email id of the beneficary.

accountWithBankCountryId.description: The country of the beneficiary institution i.e. where the final creditor holds an account

paymentRequestedForexCustomerRate.description: It indicates the customer rate for the conversion between payment currency and ordering currency

accountType.description: Groups the products based on their type, eg, Checking, Savings, CD etc,.

requestedCurrency.description: The currency the amount is requested in.

preAuthorizationReference.description: Contains the pre authorization reference for manually authorized funds.

sourceType.description: Indicates source type to determine base amount. Possible values are BALANCE (base amount of a property), ACTIVITY ( transaction amount against an activity) or PROPERTY (this type is currently not supported)

cutOffTime.description: The Cut off time when all executions for the day are consolidated to create a trade

simulatedAt.description: Time when payment transaction was simulated

simulationChecked.description: Indicates if simulation is performed for the payment order

lockedEventReference.description: Captures the AC.LOCKED.EVENTS id if in case the funds is available and reserved.

simulationProduct.description: Contains the payment order product which is referred during simulation from channels.

messagePriority.description: Contains the priority code of the payment message

country.description: Identifies the country of the customer.

intermediaryFiBicCode.description: BIC code of Intermediary Financial institution

intermediaryFiRoutingNo.description: Routing number of Intermediary Financial institution

creditorName.description: Name or short title of the credit account

internalStatus.description: This indicates a full description of payment purpose code. i.e. purpose of the instruction based on a set of pre-defined categories.

baseCurrency.description: Contains the currency of the arrangement which linked to the package or bundle

submitOrder.description: Contains the options yes or no to submit a payment order for execution.

id.description: The Identifier of the record created

uniqueIdentifier.description: The unique identifier/Message Reference of the record created.

T24_time.description: Time taken to response by Transact

requestParse_time.description: Time taken to parse the request by IRIS

responseParse_time.description: Time taken to parse the response by IRIS

For example: BEN(All transaction charges are to be borne by the beneficiary customer.), OUR(All transaction charges are to be borne by the ordering customer.), SHA(Transaction charges on the Sender's side are to be borne by the ordering customer, transaction charges on the Receiver's side are to be borne by the beneficiary customer.)

beneficiaryId.description: Indicates the reference of the financial institution that allows access to the beneficiary information

beneficiaryAccountId.description: Unique account identifier of the beneficiary account number.

beneficiaryBIC.description: BIC (Bank Identifier Code) of the beneficiary customer

beneficiaryName.description: Short title or short name of the beneficiary

accountWithBankBIC.description: This is the BIC code of the institution where beneficiary holds an account

beneficiaryBankClearingCode.description: Clearing code or sort code of the beneficiary bank

accountWithBankClearingCode.description: This is the national clearing code or sort code of the institution where beneficiary holds an account

clearingChannel.description: Indicates the clearing channel for the payment in the ISO format of the Clearing System Identifiers

structuredCreditorReference.description: Contains description of the credit account reference

beneficiaryIBAN.description: International Bank Account Number (IBAN) of the beneficiary account, required only for International transfers/payments outside the Bank. For example: GB98 MIDL07009312345678, FR7630006000011234567890189

accountWithBankIBAN.description: This is the IBAN of the institution where beneficiary holds an account

requiredCreditValueDate.description: The credit value date i.e. tentative date on which the payment system will process the payment

purpose.description: Purpose identifier of the payment or transaction, for SEPA payments in general.

structuredCommunicationCode.description: Creditor reference in a coded form i.e - RADM (RemittanceAdviceMessage) - RPIN (RelatedPaymentInstruction) - FXDR (ForeignExchangeDealReference) - DISP (DispatchAdvice) - PUOR (PurchaseOrder) - SCOR (StructuredCommunicationReference)

endToEndReference.description: Indicates the end to end reference for the payment. This field can be provided by the person who instructs the payment and this flows through the lifecycle of the payment.

instructionIdReference.description: Indicates the SEPA purpose of the SEPA Payment

termsAndConditions.description: Specifies the terms and conditions in the text format for the payment instruction, if any.

indicativeRate.description: The indicative rate at the time of submitting a payment initiation request. Actual rate with which the payment will be processed will be calculated/ fetched during payment processing.

chargeAccountId.description: Indicates the account to which the charges has to be levied. Used when charges are to be taken from a separate account

chargeAccountCurrencyId.description: When a charge account is specified, this field indicates the currency of the charge account

creditValueDate.description: Reference quoted by the credit account for a payment

PSDCompliant.description: Defines whether the transaction is PSD (Payment Services Directive) compliant or not.

totalDebitAmount.description: The total debit amount including the charges associated for the payment

localInstrumentCode.description: List of transfer type has been mentioned locally in a record

recordStatus.description: General status of the record. Possible values: - null - authorised - IHLD - input, on hold - INAU - input, not authorised - INA2 - input, authorised, pending second authorisation - INAO - input, not authorised with blocking overrides - RNAU - reversed, not authorised - RNAO - reversed, not authorised with blocking overrides

bulkReference.description: Contains bulk master reference for the payment.

bulkTypeId.description: Identifier of the bulk update type record that holds default conditions required for Bulk Master creation. SINGLE and MULTI are two record references used by payment order application for processing payments induced through Bulk Master.

action.description: Refers to view or cancel options.

cancelReason.description: Contains the reason for which the payment is cancelled.

cancelRemark.description: Contains the remarks given for cancellation.

initiationTime.description: Initiation of the payment time details

orderInitiationType.description: It indicates whether the payment was initiated by bank user, corporate or private client

beneficiaryPhoneNumber.description: Contains phone number of the beneficiary.

beneficiaryEmailId.description: Contains email id of the beneficary.

accountWithBankCountryId.description: The country of the beneficiary institution i.e. where the final creditor holds an account

paymentRequestedForexCustomerRate.description: It indicates the customer rate for the conversion between payment currency and ordering currency

accountType.description: Groups the products based on their type, eg, Checking, Savings, CD etc,.

requestedCurrency.description: The currency the amount is requested in.

preAuthorizationReference.description: Contains the pre authorization reference for manually authorized funds.

sourceType.description: Indicates source type to determine base amount. Possible values are BALANCE (base amount of a property), ACTIVITY ( transaction amount against an activity) or PROPERTY (this type is currently not supported)

cutOffTime.description: The Cut off time when all executions for the day are consolidated to create a trade

simulatedAt.description: Time when payment transaction was simulated

simulationChecked.description: Indicates if simulation is performed for the payment order

lockedEventReference.description: Captures the AC.LOCKED.EVENTS id if in case the funds is available and reserved.

simulationProduct.description: Contains the payment order product which is referred during simulation from channels.

messagePriority.description: Contains the priority code of the payment message

country.description: Identifies the country of the customer.

intermediaryFiBicCode.description: BIC code of Intermediary Financial institution

intermediaryFiRoutingNo.description: Routing number of Intermediary Financial institution

creditorName.description: Name or short title of the credit account

internalStatus.description: This indicates a full description of payment purpose code. i.e. purpose of the instruction based on a set of pre-defined categories.

baseCurrency.description: Contains the currency of the arrangement which linked to the package or bundle

submitOrder.description: Contains the options yes or no to submit a payment order for execution.

id.description: The Identifier of the record created

uniqueIdentifier.description: The unique identifier/Message Reference of the record created.

T24_time.description: Time taken to response by Transact

requestParse_time.description: Time taken to parse the request by IRIS

responseParse_time.description: Time taken to parse the response by IRIS

code.description: The code related to override message.

options.description: The usable options for the override.

code.description: The identifier of the error message
The identifier of the error message

message.description: The actual Transact error message for bad requests

type.description: The identifier of error type: Business

message.description: The actual Transact error message caused by server

type.description: The identifier of error type: System

requestParse_time.description: Time taken to parse the request by IRIS

responseParse_time.description: Time taken to parse the response by IRIS

page_size.description: The total number of records per page

page_start.description: The record from which the response should be displayed

total_size.description: The total number of records present

page_token.description: Unique id expected to get as part of response from Transact on every enquiry request

debits.description: Sum of all the debit transactions

debitAccountId.description: Indicates the debit account number of the payment or transaction.

debitAccountIBAN.description: International Bank Account Number (IBAN) of the debtor account, required only for International transfers/payments outside the Bank. For example: GB98 MIDL07009312345678, FR7630006000011234567890189

debitCurrency.description: Currency of the debit account. For example: USD, EUR etc.

debitValueDate.description: Date on which the amount will be debited for settlement

totalDebitAmount.description: The total debit amount including the charges associated for the payment

accountName.description: Display name or short name of the account specified.

credits.description: Sum of all the credit transactions

creditAccountId.description: Credit account identifier of the payment or transaction

creditAccountIBAN.description: Indicates the IBAN of the credit account

requiredCreditValueDate.description: The credit value date i.e. tentative date on which the payment system will process the payment

creditValueDate.description: Reference quoted by the credit account for a payment

creditAccountName.description: Account name details of the creditor

narratives.description: The additional text printed on descriptive statements in addition to the standard narrative and/or reference

narrative.description: The additional text printed on descriptive statements in addition to the standard narrative and/or reference

additionalInformations.description: Additional Information provided to add context

additionalInformation.description: Additional Information provided to add context

remittanceInformations.description: Indicates the remittance information that is supplied to enable the matching/reconciliation of an entry with the items that the payment is intended to settle, such as commercial invoices in an accounts' receivable system, in an unstructured form.

remittanceInformation.description: Indicates the remittance information that is supplied to enable the matching/reconciliation of an entry with the items that the payment is intended to settle, such as commercial invoices in an accounts' receivable system, in an unstructured form.

accountWithBankIBAN.description: This is the IBAN of the institution where beneficiary holds an account

invoiceReferences.description: It provides the reference of the invoice

invoiceReference.description: It provides the reference of the invoice

charges.description: Defines the charges collected for a transaction

chargeAccountId.description: Indicates the account to which the charges has to be levied. Used when charges are to be taken from a separate account

chargeAccountCurrencyId.description: When a charge account is specified, this field indicates the currency of the charge account

chargeType.description: Indicates the charge types which are applicable for the transaction. Example: CORRBKCHG

chargeName.description: The description of the charge to be taken for payment

chargeCurrencyId.description: Specifies the currency of the charge amount. Allowed only when a charge amount is specified

chargeAmount.description: Retrieves the Charge Amount after redeem

chargeAccountCurrencyAmount.description: Holds the charge to be applied for the corresponding charge type for the order in the currency of the charge account

paymentOrderId.description: The unique reference number of payment

paymentOrderProductId.description: Indicates the payment order product for which payment is initiated

orderingCustomerId.description: Indicates the customer id for the ordering customer

orderingCustomerName.description: Indicates the name of Ordering Customer

executionDate.description: Date on which the transaction or payment gets processed, i.e. the processing date of the transaction.

treasuryRate.description: The Treasury rate for the conversion between payment currency and the ordering currency

forexSpread.description: The spread that is applied to the published internal exchange rates to derive the final exchange rate or the customer rate for the transaction for currency conversion between ordering currency and payment currency

forexCustomerRate.description: The exchange rate that is actually applied for currency conversion between ordering currency and payment currency in case of transactions involving FX conversion.

orderingPortfolio.description: Indicates the portfolio id for the debit side if the account belongs to a specific portfolio

creditPortfolio.description: Indicates the portfolio id for the credit side if the account belongs to a specific portfolio

orderingReference.description: The reference related to the ordering details

chargeBearer.description: Bearer of the charges of the order. For example: BEN(All transaction charges are to be borne by the beneficiary customer.), OUR(All transaction charges are to be borne by the ordering customer.), SHA(Transaction charges on the Sender's side are to be borne by the ordering customer, transaction charges on the Receiver's side are to be borne by the beneficiary customer.)

signatory.description: The authorised signatories for the payments can be specified here. More applicable in case of corporate payments where multiple signatories are required to sign a payment instruction

purpose.description: Purpose identifier of the payment or transaction, for SEPA payments in general.

currentStatus.description: This indicates the current status of payment order

internalStatus.description: This indicates a full description of payment purpose code. i.e. purpose of the instruction based on a set of pre-defined categories.

systemId.description: The system application identifier that could be used as entry reference or used as prefix in unique transaction identifiers

GPICreditValueDate.description: Field store the date and time when the credit confirmation received

beneficiaryName.description: Short title or short name of the beneficiary

rejectReasonCode.description: Indicates the reject reason code of the payment for which the recall has been rejected

bulkReference.description: Contains bulk master reference for the payment.

executionDate.description: Date on which the transaction or payment gets processed, i.e. the processing date of the transaction.

originalRequestedExecutionDate.description: Contains the original requested execution date of the payment as received from the initiating channel, indicating when the payment has to be processed by the payment system.

acceptanceDateTime.description: Contains the transaction date and time returned by the payer's payment system on submission of the payment transaction by the payer after the response to request to pay has triggerred a payment in the payment system

recallStatus.description: Indicates the recall status of the payment for which the recall has been initiated

orderType.description: Identifies the type of the order. Possible values are Single, Ifdone, Revol, oco. Single order - only one order item may be input. If done order -  If one order gets executed, the other order is also executed immediately. Revolving order -  based on the condition specified, it will wait for both the deals to be executed simultaneously. OCO -If one order gets executed, then the other order gets cancelled.

transactionAmount.description: Contains the transaction amount. This is based on the currency, either local or foreign currency

bicId.description: Bank Identifier Code (BIC) of the Beneficiary bank.

beneficiaryAccountId.description: Unique account identifier of the beneficiary account number.

beneficiaryName.description: Short title or short name of the beneficiary

applicantAccountId.description: Defines the default account to be used for reimbursement from the Applicant in the case of an Import Letter of Credit and the Drawee in the event of an Inward Collection.

paymentCurrency.description: This field holds the transaction currency or currency in which payment is initiated.

paymentAmount.description: Indicates the payment amount for the defined term, amount and payment frequency. It will include principal, charge and interest

creditValueDate.description: Reference quoted by the credit account for a payment

paymentOrderId.description: The unique reference number of payment

orderingCustomerId.description: Indicates the customer id for the ordering customer

orderingCustomerName.description: Indicates the name of Ordering Customer

debitAccountId.description: Indicates the debit account number of the payment or transaction.

beneficiaryName.description: Short title or short name of the beneficiary

executionDate.description: Date on which the transaction or payment gets processed, i.e. the processing date of the transaction.

systemId.description: The system application identifier that could be used as entry reference or used as prefix in unique transaction identifiers

recallStatus.description: Indicates the recall status of the payment for which the recall has been initiated

rejectReasonCode.description: Indicates the reject reason code of the payment for which the recall has been rejected

UETRId.description: Unique transaction reference details for payments
Unique transaction reference details for payments
